column4: Im having trouble mounting a hard drive. i tried using the FAQ, but it failed me.  :( ive used sudo mount and the diskmounter script, but got nothin. :?
to mount something, you need to know the device node, and the mount point. Do you know those for sure already?
i know its /dev/hdc1/ and /home/schala/desktop/documents
reboot why?
you want to rerun fstab mountings?
ya, ^
well, now the problem is that i reran the fstab and it STILL dosent work, lol
you should post fstab, and output of sudo fdisk -l to paste.ubuntu-nl.org
did that, but i dont think i fully understand the purpose.
show me the URL, please.
it helps me see information about the issue
your kernel thinks it is ntfs, I do not want to contest it nor you. try http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/35735/ as your fstab line, save, close the file then sudo mount -a/
by sudo fdisk -l output
oh, oh, you have " at the end of the fstab line?
no, but it had that in your pastebin post.
show output of mount on pastebin, please.
just mount
he did not get it.
I am not sure why it will not mount, but the file system seems to be ntfs, sorry, it is not something I know what to do about.
ya, or ask again later maybe someone will know.
welcome.
